com.myscript.atk.sltw

Interface SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnInsertHandleDragListener

  • Enclosing interface:
    SingleLineTextWidgetApi

    public static interface SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnInsertHandleDragListener
    Interface definition for callbacks to be invoked during a drag sequence of the insert handle.

    A drag sequence of the insert handle is initiated when the insert handle is visible, continues as long as the user drags it around in the writing area and ends when the user releases the handle.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onInsertHandleDragBegin()
      Called when the user starts dragging the insert handle.
      void onInsertHandleDragEnd(boolean snapped)
      Called when the user stops dragging the insert handle.

    • Method Detail

      • onInsertHandleDragBegin

        void onInsertHandleDragBegin()
        Called when the user starts dragging the insert handle.

      • onInsertHandleDragEnd

        void onInsertHandleDragEnd(boolean snapped)
        Called when the user stops dragging the insert handle.

        The user can drag the handle to adjust the width of the insertion window. If the user drags the handle near enough to the edge of the text, the widget snaps both parts of the text to make them appear like one. This situation is indicated by the parameter snapped.

        You may choose to take action at the end of the insert handle drag sequence based on the value of the snapped parameter. If snapped is false, this means that both parts of the text are quite far from each other and the widget shall remain in insertion mode. If snapped is true, this means that the both parts of the text are currently presented as one with no visible insertion window in between. In this case, you should call SingleLineTextWidgetApi.setCorrectionMode() to close the insertion window and switch to correction mode.

        The widget does not switch modes automatically.

        Parameters:
        snapped - true if text is snapped and the widget shall be switched to correction mode, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SingleLineTextWidgetApi.setCorrectionMode()
